Block B (mass 2m) is initially at rest on the ground.

After collision, blocks A and B stick together (perfectly inelastic collision).

After collision: A and B stick together, so their combined mass is (m + 2m) = 3m, Momentum after collision = 3mv₂
Heat generated = Energy lost during collision = Initial KE - Final KE, Initial KE before collision: KE of A = ½mv₁² = ½m(2gh) = mgh, KE of B = 0, Total initial KE = mgh
Final KE immediately after collision: KE of combined A+B = ½(3m)v₂² = ½(3m)(√(2gh)/3)² = ½(3m)(2gh/9) = mgh/3
